SENT.plain: A case of cerebral venous thrombosis caused by undiagnosed homocystinuria is reported
The pitfalls regarding the diagnosis of a potentially medically treatable condition are discussed
Cerebral venous thrombosis in children has a variable type of onset and a multiplicity of causes
This type of pathology, although not frequent, is more common than previously thought
Among the different etiologies, undiagnosed homocystinuria is not routinely considered
We report a case of venous thrombosis of the left transverse cerebral sinus in a girl with drug-resistant partial epilepsy and homocystinuria
This diagnosis was considered and confirmed after the appearance of acute cerebral symptoms caused by venous thrombosis
